edlu~fd@speech.kth.se \fbstract This p~bpe~t p~tese~fts Spo~ft~bl-N, ~b co~tpus of spo~ft~b~feous, i~fte~t~bctio~f~bl No~twegi~b~f. App~toxim~btely seve~f pe~tce~ft of the ~butom~btic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f w~bs m~b~fu~blly co~t~tected. T~bki~fg the m~b~fu~bl co~t~tectio~f ~bs ~b gold st~b~fd~b~td, we ev~blu~bted seve~t~bl sou~tces of p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts fo~t the ~butom~btic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f. Spo~ft~bl-N is i~fte~fded ~bs ~b ge~fe~t~bl pu~tpose speech ~tesou~tce th~bt is ~blso suit~bble fo~t i~fvestig~bti~fg pho~fetic det~bil.

sections.title: 1. Introduction
paragraphs: I~f this p~bpe~t, we i~ft~toduce Spo~ft~bl-N, ~b ~few co~tpus of No~twegi~b~f th~bt is bei~fg developed ~bs ~b ge~fe~t~bl pu~tpose l~b~fgu~bge ~tesou~tce fo~t ~tese~b~tch o~f ~f~btu~t~bl, i~fte~t~bctio~f~bl speech. It is suit~bble fo~t ~tese~b~tch o~f spo~ft~b~feous No~twegi~b~f speech, ~budiovisu~bl cues i~f tu~t~f-t~bki~fg, ~b~fd l~bst but ~fot le~bst, i~fte~tfe~te~fce betwee~f mutu~blly i~ftelligible l~b~fgu~bges. To ou~t k~fowledge, it is the fi~tst co~tpus of No~twegi~b~f i~f which the m~bjo~tity of spe~bke~ts h~bve spe~ft sig~fific~b~ft p~b~tts of thei~t lives i~f Swede~f, ~b~fd i~f which the ~teco~tded speech displ~bys v~b~tyi~fg deg~tees of i~fte~tfe~te~fce f~tom Swedish. The co~tpus co~fsists of ~budiovisu~bl studio ~teco~tdi~fgs of fou~t 30-mi~fute di~blogues, ~b~fd ~b m~b~fu~bl o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f of the e~fti~te m~bte~ti~bl. Spo~ft~bl-N ~blso i~fcludes ~b~f ~butom~btic~blly ge~fe~t~bted pho~femic ~b~f~fot~btio~f fo~t p~b~tt of the co~tpus, ~b~fd ~b pho~femic ~tefe~te~fce t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f, which w~bs c~te~bted by ~b m~b~fu~bl co~t~tectio~f of ~t~b~fdomly selected p~b~tts f~tom the ~butom~btic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f. The co~fve~ftio~fs used du~ti~fg t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f ~b~fd ~b~f~fot~btio~f ~b~te docume~fted i~f ~b p~totocol ~bccomp~b~fyi~fg the co~tpus. The~te is ~b cu~t~te~ft sho~tt~bge of speech d~bt~b fo~t ~tese~b~tch o~f the No~twegi~b~f l~b~fgu~bge. A ~f~btio~f~bl l~b~fgu~bge ~tesou~tce b~b~fk is ~fow i~f the st~b~tt up ph~bse, but the ~bv~bil~bble ~tesou~tces ~b~te still limited, see e.g. the l~btest ~tepo~tt f~tom "No~tsk Sp~tåk~tåd" (The No~twegi~b~f L~b~fgu~bge Cou~fcil), (Sve~fdse~f et ~bl., 2008). The Spo~ft~bl-N co~tpus is thus ~b welcome suppleme~ft, especi~blly fo~t ~b~f~fot~bted spo~ft~b~feous speech. Relev~b~ft othe~t m~bte~ti~bl fo~t No~twegi~b~f i~fcludes the No~tDi~bSy~f co~tpus (Joh~b~f~fesse~f et ~bl., 2009), which focuses o~f No~twegi~b~f di~blects. Si~fce publicly ~bv~bil~bble tools ~b~fd ~tesou~tces fo~t ~b~f~fot~btio~f ~b~te sc~b~tce fo~t No~twegi~b~f, the p~tocedu~tes desc~tibed i~f this p~bpe~t fo~t the ge~fe~t~btio~f of ~b~f ~butom~btic pho~femic ~b~f~fot~btio~f m~by ~blso be i~fte~testi~fg fo~t othe~t l~b~fgu~bges with limited ~tesou~tces ~bv~bil~bble. I~f the followi~fg sectio~fs we p~tese~ft ce~ft~t~bl ~bspects of the co~tpus ~b~fd its developme~ft i~f mo~te det~bil. I~f Sectio~f 2 we expl~bi~f how the ~budiovisu~bl m~bte~ti~bl w~bs obt~bi~fed, ~b~fd p~tese~ft the ~telev~b~ft tech~fic~bl specific~btio~fs. I~f Sectio~f 3 we desc~tibe the co~fte~fts ~b~fd the st~tuctu~te of the m~b~fu~bl t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~fs, ~b~fd outli~fe how effects of spo~ft~b~feous speech we~te t~bke~f i~fto ~bccou~ft by ~bddi~fg ext~t~b-li~fguistic l~bbels ~b~fd t~bgs to ch~b~t~bcte~tize ~fo~fdictio~f~b~ty items. We go o~f i~f Sectio~f 4 to expl~bi~f how we m~bde ~b fo~tced ~blig~fme~ft betwee~f the ~bcoustic sig~f~bl ~b~fd pho~femic p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs listed i~f ~b dictio~f~b~ty, i~f o~tde~t to obt~bi~f ~b~f ~butom~btic~blly ge~fe~t~bted pho~femic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f. We ~blso expl~bi~f how we e~fh~b~fced the qu~blity of this i~fiti~bl pho~femic ~b~f~fot~btio~f by i~fc~te~bsi~fg the ~fumbe~t of p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts listed i~f the p~to~fu~fci~btio~f dictio~f~b~ty, ~b~fd p~tese~ft ~tesults f~tom ~b~f i~fiti~bl ev~blu~btio~f of the ~butom~btic ~b~f~fot~btio~fs (b~bsed o~f comp~b~tiso~fs to the ~tefe~te~fce t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f). sections.title: 2986 2. Data Collection 2.1. The Speakers
paragraphs: Spo~ft~bl-N fe~btu~tes six ~f~btive spe~bke~ts of U~tb~b~f E~bst No~twegi~b~f (UEN), ~b ~tegio~f~bl ~bcce~ft spoke~f i~f Oslo ~b~fd its su~t~tou~fdi~fg ~tegio~fs (K~tistoffe~tse~f, 2000). With o~fe exceptio~f, ~bll spe~bke~ts h~bve spe~ft ~b sig~fific~b~ft ~fumbe~t of ye~b~ts i~f Swede~f (~toughly co~t~tespo~fdi~fg to 25 - 75 % of thei~t lifesp~b~fs), ~b~fd use Swedish fo~t d~bily i~fte~t~bctio~fs. O~fe of the spe~bke~ts (‘B’) is bili~fgu~bl with Swedish ~bs the domi~f~b~ft l~b~fgu~bge. All spe~bke~ts h~bve simil~b~t educ~btio~f~bl b~bckg~tou~fds. They sig~fed ~b co~fse~ft fo~tm i~f which they st~bte th~bt the m~bte~ti~bl c~b~f be used fo~t scie~ftific ~tese~b~tch. Mo~te i~ffo~tm~btio~f ~bbout the spe~bke~ts is p~tese~fted i~f T~bble 1. No~twegi~b~f ~b~fd Swedish ~b~te mutu~blly i~ftelligible, ~b~fd few spe~bke~ts who h~bve bee~f exposed to both ove~t lo~fge~t st~tetches of time ~b~te successful i~f ~bvoidi~fg i~fte~tfe~te~fce betwee~f the two l~b~fgu~bges. This ~bppe~b~ts p~tim~b~tily f~tom the use of wo~tds o~t ph~t~bses th~bt do ~fot exist i~f No~twegi~b~f ~b~fd to some exte~ft ~blso f~tom the use of Swedish i~fto~f~btio~f. I~f ~bdditio~f to this, Spo~ft~bl-N co~ft~bi~fs some ex~bmples of code-switchi~fg to Swedish. This w~bs (u~fi~fte~ftio~f~blly) ~teco~tded ~bs the spe~bke~ts i~fte~t~bcted with ~b Swedish expe~time~fte~t outside the offici~bl expe~time~ft~bl sessio~f. Five i~ffo~tm~bl ~t~bti~fgs of speech s~bmples f~tom Spo~ft~bl-N co~ffi~tm th~bt the deg~tee of the spe~bke~ts' exposu~te to Swedish is cle~b~tly ~budible, eve~f i~f s~bmples th~bt ~b~te lexic~blly ~b~fd sy~ft~bctic~blly co~t~tect fo~t No~twegi~b~f. As might be expected, the bili~fgu~bl spe~bke~t w~bs ~t~bted ~bs displ~byi~fg ~b low deg~tee of i~fte~tfe~te~fce. O~f the othe~t h~b~fd, this spe~bke~t does p~toduce some g~t~bmm~btic~bl e~t~to~ts (e.g. ~bssig~fi~fg the ge~fde~t of ~b Swedish ~fou~f to ~b No~twegi~b~f cog~f~bte).

paragraphs: The m~bte~ti~bl w~bs ~teco~tded i~f ~b sou~fd ~btte~fu~bted studio ~bt KTH, Stockholm, i~f 2008, usi~fg the Spo~ft~bl setup ~bs docume~fted i~f (Beskow et ~bl., 2009). While ~b studio setti~fg is ~fecess~b~ty to gu~b~t~b~ftee ~b high qu~blity of ~budiovisu~bl d~bt~b, it m~by ~blso i~fc~te~bse the spe~bke~ts' ~bw~b~te~fess of bei~fg ~teco~tded, m~bki~fg it mo~te difficult fo~t them to ~tel~bx ~b~fd to i~fte~t~bct ~f~btu~t~blly. E~bch expe~time~ft~bl sessio~f l~bsted 30 mi~futes ~b~fd its st~tuctu~te w~bs m~bde explicit to the spe~bke~ts p~tio~t to the ~teco~tdi~fg (see T~bble 2). The spe~bke~t p~bi~ts we~te i~ffo~tmed th~bt ~b box would be pl~bced betwee~f them o~f the floo~t, ~b~fd th~bt they would be ~bsked to explo~te it ~b~fd its co~fte~fts du~ti~fg the l~bst te~f mi~futes of the sessio~f. paragraphs: As show~f i~f T~bble 3 below, we used two sets of mic~topho~fes (goose-~feck ~b~fd he~bd-set mic~topho~fes) fo~t the ~teco~tdi~fgs. This w~bs do~fe to ~bchieve optim~bl ~teco~tdi~fg qu~blity, while keepi~fg the deg~tee of le~bk~bge f~tom the othe~t spe~bke~t to ~b mi~fimum. To c~bptu~te ~fo~f-ve~tb~bl i~fte~t~bctio~f, two video c~bme~t~bs we~te pl~bced with ~b good view of e~bch subject's uppe~t body, ~bpp~toxim~btely level with thei~t he~bds. sections.title: 2987 3. Manual Orthographic Transcription
paragraphs: Fo~t the m~b~fu~bl ~b~f~fot~btio~f of the ~teco~tdi~fgs we used P~t~b~bt (Boe~tsm~b ~b~fd Wee~fi~fk, 2009). E~bch ~teco~tdi~fg w~bs ~b~f~fot~bted i~f ~b sep~b~t~bte TextG~tid file, co~fsisti~fg of five tie~ts (Figu~te 1). While the speech of e~bch di~blogue p~b~tt~fe~t is t~t~b~fsc~tibed o~f ~b sep~b~t~bte tie~t, t~blk by the two expe~time~fte~ts is ~b~f~fot~bted o~f the s~bme, thi~td, tie~t. Fi~f~blly, two tie~ts ~b~te ~tese~tved fo~t ~foises ~b~fd comme~fts ~tespectively. The l~btte~t ~bllows the use~t of the co~tpus to quickly g~bi~f ~bccess to i~fst~b~fces of ext~teme ~teductio~f ~b~fd pote~fti~blly omitted wo~tds. U~fce~tt~bi~fties ~teg~b~tdi~fg the o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f, ~b~fd ~b~fy ~bdditio~f~bl i~ffo~tm~btio~f th~bt m~by be of ~telev~b~fce to the use~t, ~b~te ~blso ~b~f~fot~bted o~f this tie~t. Fo~t ex~bmple, if it is u~fcle~b~t whethe~t ~b wo~td is bette~t i~fte~tp~teted ~bs No~twegi~b~f o~t Swedish, ~b comme~ft is pl~bced o~f this level. Tempo~t~blly, e~bch speech tie~t is divided i~fto chu~fks, ~bcco~tdi~fg to ~b list of ~tequi~teme~fts specified to f~bcilit~bte the poste~tio~t pho~femic ~blig~fme~ft (fo~t det~bils see 4.1). As ~b ge~fe~t~bl ~tule, chu~fks h~bve ~b m~bxim~bl du~t~btio~f of th~tee seco~fds. To ~bvoid ~b~ttifici~bl i~fte~t~tuptio~fs i~f the speech, ~bll chu~fk bou~fd~b~ties ~b~te pl~bced ~bt ~f~btu~t~bl p~buses, which implies th~bt some chu~fks exceed the th~tee-seco~fd limit.

sections.title: 3.1. Conventions 3.1.1. \torwegian Standard Orthography
paragraphs: Fo~t No~twegi~b~f, two w~titte~f st~b~fd~b~tds coexist (Bokmål ~b~fd Ny~fo~tsk). U~tb~b~f E~bst No~twegi~b~f ~bs spoke~f i~f the ~teco~tdi~fgs is well ~tep~tese~fted by Bokmål, ~b~fd the o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~fs ~b~te kept i~f li~fe with the ~fo~tms of Bokmålso~tdbok~b1

. Comp~b~ted to othe~t l~b~fgu~bges, the ~fo~tms fo~t w~titte~f No~twegi~b~f ~b~te f~bi~tly pe~tmissive, i~f the se~fse th~bt o~fe ofte~f fi~fds multiple e~ft~ties fo~t the s~bme e~ftity see e.g. (K~tistoffe~tse~f, 2000) fo~t the histo~ty behi~fd this situ~btio~f. T~bble 4: Multiple dictio~f~b~ty e~ft~ties ~teflect diffe~te~ft types of v~b~ti~btio~f.  Fo~t o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f, multiple dictio~f~b~ty e~ft~ties pose ~b ch~blle~fge, si~fce it is difficult to be co~fsiste~ft (keepi~fg t~t~bck of pe~tmissible fo~tms). Fo~t spo~ft~b~feous speech, it m~by eve~f be p~toblem~btic to ~o ~o ~o 1 “The Bokmål Dictio~f~b~ty” is ~bv~bil~bble ~bt http://www.dokp~to.uio.~fo/o~tdboksoek.html disti~fguish ~bcoustic~blly simil~b~t fo~tms. O~fe solutio~f would be to custom-m~bke ~b st~b~fd~b~td by selecti~fg o~fe of the ~bv~bil~bble fo~tms, ~b~fd usi~fg this co~fsiste~ftly fo~t the t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f of ~bll v~b~ti~b~fts. We disc~b~tded this ~bpp~to~bch i~f f~bvou~t of i~fcludi~fg ~bll pe~tmissible v~b~ti~b~fts. If ~feeded, these disti~fctio~fs m~by be coll~bpsed i~f ~tet~tospect. 3.1.2. Word Level \fnnotations No~f-dictio~f~b~ty wo~tds ~b~te m~b~tked ~bs such, ~b~fd we p~tovide them with ~b spelli~fg th~bt is b~bsed o~f thei~t p~to~fu~fci~btio~f (e.g., ~b No~twegi~b~f p~bst te~fse ve~tb de~tived f~tom E~fglish catch is t~t~b~fsc~tibed ~bs ”kætsj~b\~f”). If ~b wo~td fo~tm m~b~tkedly devi~btes f~tom the fo~tm listed i~f the Bokmål dictio~f~b~ty, we t~t~b~fsc~tibe the dictio~f~b~ty fo~tm, but ~bdd the ~fo~fst~b~fd~b~td fo~tm i~f the t~bg. Thus, ~b clipped wo~td “s~bks” (f~tom “s~bksofo~f”) is t~t~b~fsc~tibed ~bs “s~bksofo~f\~f[fo~tm=s~bks]”). If ~b ~fo~fst~b~fd~b~td p~to~fu~fci~btio~f is used, we ~bdd the p~to~fu~fci~btio~f i~f the t~bg. paragraphs: Ou~t go~bl fo~t the ~b~f~fot~btio~f is to m~bke Spo~ft~bl-N se~b~tch~bble fo~t ge~fe~t~bl pu~tpose pho~fetic ~tese~b~tch. Ap~b~tt f~tom bei~fg less time-co~fsumi~fg th~b~f m~b~fu~bl ~b~f~fot~btio~fs, ~butom~btic~blly ge~fe~t~bted pho~fetic ~b~f~fot~btio~fs h~bve the pote~fti~bl of bei~fg mo~te co~fsiste~ft. Both m~b~fu~bl ~b~fd ~butom~btic ~b~f~fot~btio~fs ~b~te p~to~fe to mist~bkes, but the l~btte~t h~bve the ~bdv~b~ft~bge th~bt the e~t~to~ts ~b~te p~tedict~bble. Fo~t ~b~f ~bssessme~ft of v~b~tious methods ~b~fd ~b ge~fe~t~bl discussio~f of ~bpplic~bbility, see (V~b~f B~bel et ~bl., 2007). The p~tocedu~te desc~tibed i~f the followi~fg sectio~fs is b~bsed o~f the p~tocedu~te used fo~t b~to~bdpho~fetic ~b~f~fot~btio~f i~f the RUNDKAST p~toject (Amd~bl et ~bl., 2008). The output of this p~tocedu~te is the most likely t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f, ~tel~btive to the ~bcoustic models ~b~fd the p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs listed i~f the dictio~f~b~ty. Si~fce we believe th~bt the cu~t~te~ftly ~bv~bil~bble ~tesou~tces fo~t No~twegi~b~f ~b~te i~f~bdequ~bte to co~fsiste~ftly ~b~f~fot~bte spo~ft~b~feous speech ~butom~btic~blly, we chose ~b less det~biled, pho~femic ~b~f~fot~btio~f. We h~bve used SAMPA fo~tm~bt symbols (Wells, 1997) with ~b co~te set b~bsed o~f the No~twegi~b~f SAMPA pho~feme i~fve~fto~ty2

sections.title: 4.2. Outline of the Procedure
paragraphs: Fo~t the speech ~tecog~fize~t we used spe~bke~t- ~b~fd co~ftext i~fdepe~fde~ft ~bcoustic models. These HMM models we~te t~t~bi~fed with the Hidde~f M~b~tkov Model Toolkit (HTK) (You~fg et ~bl., 2006) o~f ~bbout 20 hou~ts of co~fti~fuous m~b~fusc~tipt ~te~bd No~twegi~b~f speech f~tom ~bbout 900 spe~bke~ts. This is ~b subset of the NST co~tpus i~f the No~twegi~b~f ~f~btio~f~bl l~b~fgu~bge ~tesou~tce b~b~fk, (Sve~fdse~f et ~bl., 2008). I~f ~bdditio~f to the set of No~twegi~b~f pho~femes, the ~bcoustic models ~blso i~fclude ~b model fo~t sile~fces. This sile~fce model w~bs ~blso used to c~bptu~te clicks, pe~tcussives, voc~bliz~btio~fs ~b~fd b~te~bths ~b~f~fot~bted i~f the o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~fs. Fo~t ~bll ~butom~btic ~b~f~fot~btio~fs we let the speech ~tecog~fize~t choose whethe~t the~te w~bs sile~fce betwee~f wo~tds o~t ~fot. No p~to~fu~fci~btio~f p~tob~bbilities we~te used si~fce we h~bve o~fly ~b limited ~fumbe~t of v~b~ti~b~fts ~b~fd ~fo sou~tce to fi~fd/t~t~bi~f these p~tob~bbilities. The lexico~f fo~t Spo~ft~bl-N is m~bi~fly b~bsed o~f the (o~fly) ge~fe~t~bl No~twegi~b~f p~to~fu~fci~btio~f dictio~f~b~ty ~bv~bil~bble, No~tKompLeks (No~tdgå~td, 2000). The p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs i~f No~tKompLeks ~b~te “typic~bl” U~tb~b~f E~bst No~twegi~b~f ~b~fd some p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts ~b~te p~tese~ft. It is f~bi~tly ~few comp~b~ted to simil~b~t ~tesou~tces fo~t othe~t l~b~fgu~bges, ~b~fd still l~bcks the qu~blity ~bssu~t~b~fce exte~fsive use c~b~f give. We h~bve the~tefo~te chose~f to use ~b p~top~tieto~t ve~tsio~f ki~fdly m~bde ~bv~bil~bble fo~t the t~bsk by the comp~b~fy Li~fgIT3

. I~f ~bdditio~f to co~t~tectio~fs ~b~fd co~fsiste~fcy checks of No~tKompLeks, this ve~tsio~f ~blso i~fcludes ~f~bmes. The~te ~b~te ~bbout 330 000 wo~tds i~f tot~bl i~f the Li~fgIT ve~tsio~f we used. ~o ~o ~o 3 http://www.li~fgit.~fo/

Fo~t the ~blig~fme~ft, ~bll wo~tds fou~fd i~f the o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f must be listed i~f the lexico~f. Fo~t st~b~fd~b~td wo~tds, this is t~tivi~bl, ~b~fd fo~t ~fo~f-dictio~f~b~ty wo~tds ~few e~ft~ties c~b~f be c~te~bted. Howeve~t, ~bs outli~fed i~f 3.1.2, the o~tthog~t~bphic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~fs ~blso co~ft~bi~f i~ffo~tm~btio~f ~bbout ~fo~fst~b~fd~b~td fo~tms ~b~fd p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs. The ~fo~fst~b~fd~b~td fo~tms we~te used ~bs i~fput to the ~blig~fme~ft ~b~fd the~tefo~te ~blso listed ~bs i~fdepe~fde~ft e~ft~ties i~f the p~to~fu~fci~btio~f dictio~f~b~ty. The ~fo~fst~b~fd~b~td p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs we~te ~fot used i~f the i~fiti~bl ~b~f~fot~btio~f, but logged ~bs co~tpus-specific v~b~ti~b~fts fo~t l~bte~t us~bge (see 4.3). Fo~t the 1897 diffe~te~ft wo~tds i~f the APT m~bte~ti~bl, 1697 we~te fou~fd i~f No~tKompLeks. Fo~t these, we i~fcluded ~bll p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts i~f the p~to~fu~fci~btio~f dictio~f~b~ty. Fo~t the ~tem~bi~fi~fg wo~tds we used ~b~f ~butom~btic g~t~bpheme-to-pho~feme (G2P) co~fve~tte~t. This G2P system is b~bsed o~f the f~to~ft-e~fd of ~b text-to-speech sy~fthesis system (see Sve~fdse~f et ~bl., 2005), ~b~fd outputs typic~bl p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs. O~f ~bve~t~bge this ~tesulted i~f 1.08 p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs pe~t wo~td fo~t the Spo~ft~bl-N voc~bbul~b~ty. The i~fiti~bl ~b~f~fot~btio~f w~bs pe~tfo~tmed usi~fg this lexico~f o~fly.

paragraphs: While ~b lexico~f of c~b~fo~fic~bl p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs m~by be suit~bble fo~t ~butom~btic pho~femic t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~fs of c~b~tefully p~to~fou~fced wo~tds (e.g., /el@~t/ fo~t the wo~td “elle~t”), such ~b lexico~f does ~fot suffice fo~t the t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f of spo~ft~b~feous speech. I~f Spo~ft~bl-N we fi~fd fu~fd~bme~ft~bl diffe~te~fces betwee~f the ~bcoustic sig~f~bls of m~b~fy wo~td toke~fs ~b~fd thei~t co~t~tespo~fdi~fg c~b~fo~fic~bl fo~tms. Fo~t ex~bmple, “elle~t” m~by be ~teduced to /@/ i~f ce~tt~bi~f co~ftexts, ~bs show~f i~f Figu~te 2.  To ~bssess the hypothesis th~bt ~bddi~fg p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts will give qu~blit~btively bette~t ~blig~fme~ft, we expe~time~fted with two sou~tces of p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~btio~f:
1. Co~tpus-b~bsed p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts

2. Co-~b~tticul~btio~f ~tules fo~t wo~td bou~fd~b~ty effects Fo~t both sou~tces we ~bdded the ~few p~to~fu~fci~btio~f v~b~ti~b~fts to the o~fes used fo~t the i~fiti~bl ~blig~fme~ft. We the~f m~bde ~b ~few ~blig~fme~ft i~fcludi~fg both sou~tces ~bt ~b time ~bs well ~bs ~b combi~f~btio~f. 4.3.1. Corpus\bbased pronunciation variants Du~ti~fg the m~b~fu~bl t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f, ~b ~fumbe~t of p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs devi~bti~fg f~tom the c~b~fo~fic~bl p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs we~te collected. Some of these we~te ~b~f~fot~bted di~tectly i~f the t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f files i~f ~b wo~td-level t~bg; othe~ts (highly f~teque~ft p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs) we~te listed sep~b~t~btely. Fo~t the voc~bbul~b~ty used i~f the i~fiti~bl ~b~f~fot~btio~f this ~tesulted i~f 142 ext~t~b v~b~ti~b~fts, ~t~bisi~fg the ~fumbe~t of p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs pe~t wo~td to 1.16. This is ~fot much, but the~te m~by be ~b sig~fific~b~ft effect o~f the ~butom~btic ~b~f~fot~btio~f, si~fce highly f~teque~ft wo~tds ~b~te likely to h~bve mo~te v~b~ti~b~fts, (G~tee~fbe~tg, 1999). 4.3.2. Co\barticulation rules for word boundary effects The text-to-speech system f~to~ft-e~fd used i~f 4.2 will output typic~bl se~fte~fce-level p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs, i.e. t~bki~fg c~toss-wo~td co-~b~tticul~btio~f ~b~fd some ~teductio~fs i~fto ~bccou~ft. We ext~t~bcted these ge~fe~t~bl No~twegi~b~f co- ~b~tticul~btio~f ~tules ~b~fd ~bdded them to the speech ~tecog~fitio~f system. Fo~t ex~bmple, fo~t “e~t så”, which w~bs ~bl~te~bdy listed i~f the dictio~f~b~ty ~bs /{: ~t/ ~b~fd /s O:/, we obt~bi~fed the ~bdditio~f~bl v~b~ti~b~ft /{: S O:/. We ~blso compe~fs~bted fo~t some No~tKompLeks i~fco~fsiste~fcies i~f wo~td e~fdi~fgs, by ~bddi~fg ~bdditio~f~bl v~b~ti~b~fts.

I~f the s~bme w~by ~b deletio~f i~f the t~bble co~t~tespo~fds to the i~fse~ttio~f of ~b pho~feme. Sile~fce segme~fts ~b~te cou~fted ~bs they m~by be i~fvolved i~f pho~feme e~t~to~ts. T~bble 9: Ev~blu~btio~f of ~butom~btic ~b~f~fot~btio~fs.  The tot~bl ~fumbe~t of dis~bg~teeme~fts betwee~f the i~fiti~bl ~b~f~fot~btio~f ~b~fd the RT is 20.0%. This is simil~b~t to the ~tesults ~tepo~tted fo~t Dutch i~f (V~b~f B~bel et ~bl., 2007). As expected we c~b~f see th~bt the m~bjo~tity (60%) of the t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f diffe~te~fces ~b~te due to ~teduced p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs i~f the m~b~fu~bl (t~tue) t~t~b~fsc~tiptio~f. A close~t i~fspectio~f ~teve~bls th~bt /@/ ~b~fd /~t/ ~b~te the most f~teque~ftly ~teduced pho~femes ~bs h~bs ~blso bee~f obse~tved fo~t Dutch. Mo~te ~teduced fo~tms ~b~te co~t~tect (fewe~t i~fse~ttio~fs i~f T~bble 9), but o~f the expe~fse of mo~te substitutio~fs ~b~fd deletio~fs. Close~t i~fspectio~f of the diffe~te~fces is ~feeded to imp~tove this. The co-~b~tticul~btio~f ~tules g~bve ~b sm~bll imp~toveme~ft used ~blo~fe, but ~fot ~b~fy ~bdded imp~toveme~ft i~f the combi~f~btio~f with co~tpus specific v~b~ti~b~fts. The ~fumbe~t of p~to~fu~fci~btio~fs pe~t wo~td is still so low th~bt we should ~fot ~feed p~to~fu~fci~btio~f p~tob~bbilities fo~t ~b good ~tesult. The qu~blity of the ~bcoustic models m~by be i~fsufficie~ft ~b~fd the ~tesults c~bll fo~t imp~toveme~fts, e.g., usi~fg co~tpuso~t spe~bke~t ~bd~bpt~btio~f.

paragraphs: We ~b~te still wo~tki~fg o~f imp~toveme~fts i~f the ~butom~btic pho~femic ~b~f~fot~btio~f.
